medical_history.chief_complaint: Left scrotal swelling, malaise, and subjective fevers.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reported gradual increase in left sided scrotal swelling with overlying redness over several days, which was non-tender and not associated with urological symptoms. He felt warm subjectively and denied other infectious symptoms. Over the past few weeks, he noticed his pulse was much slower, with rates sometimes in the 50s. Denied worsening fatigue, shortness of breath, light-headedness, dizziness, pre-syncope, or syncope.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (HTN), Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD), Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) status post two prostate surgeries, recurrent urinary tract infections (UTIs), and vertigo.
medical_history.family_history: Grandfather with history of lung cancer and pacemaker placement. Brother with multiple urological procedures since childhood. Otherwise no other significant family history.
